stories.text:
Hi, we know how much easier it is to use a PaaS service like Heroku, but it's too expensive compared to using the cloud provider directly.

Now, are you interested in a service that does the same but on your own cloud platform and charges you a flat fee? Also support AWS,GCP,Azure and DigitalOcean.
stories.title: Ask HN: Are you interested in a service like Heroku on your own cloud account?
New FDA-approved eye drops could replace reading glasses for millions
Show HN: I made a CO2 sensing Christmas ball

stories.text:
The music industry has been in a state of upheaval for the past decade. The arrival of streaming services such as Spotify and Apple Music has disrupted conventional models, bringing artists to a broader audience while eroding profit margins for labels and musicians. Artists are becoming frustrated with unfair royalty rates, limited resources for marketing, and data mining by third-party companies that profit from their hard work.

Now, we're starting to see a similar effect with cryptocurrency and blockchain technology. NFTs are a new technology that could potentially be applied to the problem of making music profitable again.

What if *FRACTIONAL OWNERSHIP* can be the solution?

You can read more about my 5-minute report in The Crypto Journal newsletter

https://thecryptojournal.substack.com/p/the-crypto-journal-issue-002
stories.title: NFTs and F-NFTs throwing the traditional music market off balance
Edison was right: Waking up right after drifting off to sleep boosts creativity

stories.text:
I am renting a Windows compute engine (gcloud) with desktop access.

I have installed VB-Audio cable on the remote Windows desktop -> https://vb-audio.com/Cable/index.htm (hosted on Azure Virtual Desktop)

I have Clubdeck/Clubhouse installed to listen to it.

My remote system sound input and output is set to the virtual devices.

This works on my local Windows installation but does not work on my remote desktop.

Has anyone had experience with this? Any pointers or triggers?

Will pay you with love and fresh air if you can help me.
stories.title: Ask HN: How to play virtual audio on Windows hosted on Google Cloud?
